text: Lu Xun (), (September 25, 1881 – October 19, 1936), was a Chinese writer. His real name is Zhou Shuren (周树人), as Lu Xun is his pen name. He was born in Shaoxing of Zhejiang Province. He had a lot of works, for example, "The True Story of Ah Q", " Medicine", and so on. Lu Xun Park in Shanghai has a museum about his life and his tomb. ==Related pages== *List of Chinese writers Category:Writers from Zhejiang Category:1881 births Category:1936 deaths Category:Pen names Category:20th-century Chinese writers Category:19th-century Chinese writers
title: Lu Xun
